name: Guild Wars 2
description: This version uses D9VK, which greatly improves performance.
notes:
With AMD graphics (with or without D9VK), it's highly recommended to use a virtual desktop as GW2's launcher will slow most desktop environments to a crawl only recoverable by hard reboot. Unsure if this affects NVIDIA. Doesn't seem to affect Intel.

Also ideal to have a context menu entry for updating the game; running GW2's exe with -image lets it download all game data and updates.
content:
files:
- client: https://s3.amazonaws.com/gw2cdn/client/branches/Gw2Setup-64.exe
- d9vk:
    filename: d9vk-m0.12.6b12583491eaab7d2a3d7b1ff1fd5dc9392761f2.zip
    url: https://git.froggi.es/joshua/d9vk/-/jobs/502/artifacts/download
game:
  arch: win64
  args: -autologin
  exe: drive_c/Program Files/Guild Wars 2/GW2-64.exe
  prefix: $GAMEDIR
installer:
- extract:
    dst: $CACHE
    file: d9vk
- move:
    dst: $HOME/.local/share/lutris/runtime/dxvk/d9vk-6b125834/
    src: $CACHE/dxvk-release/
- task:
    arch: win64
    description: Creating win64 prefix
    name: create_prefix
    prefix: $GAMEDIR
- task:
    app: faudio d3dcompiler_43 d3dx9
    name: winetricks
    prefix: $GAMEDIR
- execute:
    command: mkdir -p "$GAMEDIR/drive_c/Program Files/Guild Wars 2"
- move:
    dst: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/Program Files/Guild Wars 2/GW2-64.exe
    src: client
system:
  disable_compositor: 'true'
  env:
    DXVK_HUD: 0
    DXVK_LOG_LEVEL: none
    STAGING_SHARED_MEMORY: 1
    __GL_SHADER_DISK_CACHE_PATH: $GAMEDIR
wine:
  dxvk: true
  dxvk_version: d9vk-6b125834
  esync: true
